intro: Desmos teysmannii, commonly known as the African violet or the Malagasy violet, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves that are often velvety in texture. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, with five petals and a distinctive central spur. Desmos teysmannii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
